intro: Rhomboda velutina, commonly known as the velvet rhombodas, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying shades of white and pink. Rhomboda velutina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
